intro: Pachylobus dahomensis, commonly known as the Dahomey pachylobus, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less studied species.
